thread.title: J.J. Watt dresses as Batman to visit children's hospital
thread.title_full: J.J. Watt dresses as Batman to visit children's hospital

title: J.J. Watt dresses as Batman to visit children's hospital
text:
J.J. Watt dresses as Batman to visit children's hospital Houston Texans defensive end drops by Halloween party Published 10:40 AM CDT Oct 16, 2015 Photos Scott Halleran/Getty Images Houston Texans defensive end J.J. Watt dressed as Batman to surprise kids at Texas Children's Hospital on Tuesday. Minnesota wins 3rd WNBA title in 5 years The reigning NFL Defensive Player of the Year made the appearance during the Houston hospital's "Spirit of Halloween" event. While visiting the hospital in full Batman costume, Watt also helped decorated a pumpkin, signed autographs, gave out hugs, posed for plenty of pictures, played foosball and more. 
The visit was recorded for a special feature that will be shown on Sunday morning's edition of NBC's "The Today Show." 
The Houston Texans posted a slideshow of Watt's visit as well as a video preview . Watch: NFL's J.J. Watt Surprises Sick Kids As Batman http://t.co/dqu1WlPEf1 pic.twitter.com/i01fejqE6a
